text: Geotechnical engineer’s soil report identifies poor soils and prescribes stabilization
Proposed stabilization method (lime, cement, geogrid, chemical) approved and mix design submitted
Equipment plan (pulverizer, reclaimer, tiller) and work sequence reviewed

id: B. Site Prep and Material Delivery

text: Area stripped and graded per plan; loose organic, frozen, or debris material removed
Lime/cement stored in silos or dry conditions and verified by weight ticket or daily report
Weather conditions suitable (no standing water, temperature >5°C for lime/cement work)
Material uniformly spread at required rate (kg/m² or % by dry weight)
Full-depth mixing using reclaimer or rotary mixer performed per lift thickness
Moisture adjusted before and after mixing per geotechnical spec
Compaction completed within specified time window after mixing
Field density and moisture tests recorded and meet % compaction as per modified Proctor
Stabilized soil proof-rolled and visually inspected for deflection/pumping
Geotextile/geogrid installed over graded subgrade with overlap and anchorage
Fill placed over reinforcement in specified lift thickness without damage
Mix ticket log, QC reports, and final compaction summary submitted
As-built stabilization extent and treatment depths verified and recorded

id: • ASTM D558, D4318, D6276, D698, CSA A3000 Cementitious Standards
• GRI/GCL Geosynthetic Guidelines, Project Geotechnical Report
• Alberta Transportation / AASHTO Soil-Cement, Lime-Treated Soils
